displayName: Ensure AWS RDS Instances Block Public Access
rationale: Amazon RDS instances should be configured with Public Access disabled. Enabling this setting will ensure no IP addresses are assigned to the database instance, and access from outside the VPC prohibited. AWS Security Best Practices suggest using security groups to control database access. For more infomation, visit https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/Overview.RDSSecurityGroups.html
recommended_action:
From the console:
1. Log into your AWS account and navgiate to the RDS service home. https://console.aws.amazon.com/rds
2. Select the database you would like to change.
3. In the Connectivity & Security group, change the Public Access option to 'Not Publicly Accessible.'
4. Note the AWS warning about potential impact to database connectivity.
error_message: AWS RDS Instance public access not blocked
ruleNames: Ensure AWS RDS Instances Block Public Access
